climbs.name: Old Smoothie
climbs.fa: Chris Hirsch, Andy Koosman, Sept. 6, 2015 (Ground Up)

content.description:
P1: (5.10+) Scramble to a cozy belay between Old Roughie and Old Smoothie. Step right off the ledge to gain the crack. Corkscrew around right following a horizontal crack on jugs and tiny feet. Continue traversing to gain a vertical crack on the opposite side of the spire. Set a hanging belay here. Steep and pumpy with wild exposure and a lot of climbing!

 P2: (5.7) Place an RP, then follow side pulls and slopers on a low-angle face to the summit.

 Descent: Needles style rap, 60m rope
content.protection: Nuts, RPs, 1 x C3 - #3, 1 x Offset Cams, Long Slings
content.location: Start in the notch between Old Roughie and Old Smoothie

content.description:
This pair of aesthetic spires is perched up on a hill about 400 yards North of the Torch. Old Roughie is to the East and Old Smoothie is to the West. Old Smoothie is the taller of the pair, is split by several horizontal cracks, and has an almost spherical summit. Old Roughie has two distinct summits that are easily reached, Old Smoothie is a lot trickier.

 The summit of Portal Peak offers a great view of these eye-catching spires.
